app_metadata.description: Rest Server is a high performance HTTP server that implements restic's REST backend API.
app_metadata.name: restic-rest-server

run_as_context.description: Restic rest-server runs as any non-root user.

app_metadata.title: Restic REST Server

groups.name: User and Group Configuration
groups.description: Configure User and Group for Restic REST Server

groups.description: Configure Network for Restic REST Server

groups.name: Storage Configuration
groups.description: Configure Storage for Restic REST Server

groups.description: Configure Labels for Restic REST Server

groups.description: Configure Resources for Restic REST Server

attrs.label: Append Only
attrs.description: Enable append-only mode. In this mode, no existing snapshots can be deleted or modified.

attrs.label: Group Accessible Repositories
attrs.description: Enable group accessible repositories. In this mode, repositories can be accessed by users in the same group.

attrs.label: Private Repositories
attrs.description: Enable private repositories. In this mode, repositories can only be accessed by authenticated users.

attrs.label: No Authentication
attrs.description: Disable authentication. In this mode, no authentication is required to access the repositories.

attrs.label: Proxy Authentication Username
attrs.description: Specifies the HTTP header containing the username for proxy-based authentication

attrs.label: Basic Auth Users
attrs.description: The list of basic auth users.

attrs.label: Extra Options
attrs.description:
Additional options to pass to the Restic REST Server.
Example: --some-option=value

attrs.label: Additional Environment Variables
attrs.description: Configure additional environment variables for Restic REST Server.

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description: The user id that Restic REST Server files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group id that Restic REST Server files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

attrs.label: Host Network
attrs.description: Bind to the host network. It's recommended to keep this disabled.

attrs.label: Certificate
attrs.description: The certificate to use for Restic REST Servers.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.label: ixVolume Configuration
attrs.description: The configuration for the ixVolume dataset.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.label: Dataset Name
attrs.description: The name of the dataset to use for storage.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: The host path to use for storage.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)

attrs.description: The path inside the container to mount the storage.
